questions.question: What do you call a plant that completes its lifecycle in two years, growing vegetative structures the first year and flowering the second year?
What is the name of the protein that plays a key role in the closing and opening of stomata in response to light and water availability?
What are the two types of vascular tissue in plants?
What is the term for a flower that contains both male and female reproductive structures?
What is the term for the study of plant diseases?
What are the plant hormones responsible for cell elongation, among other roles?
What is the term for the symbiotic associations between fungi and plant roots?
What is the term for the outer protective layer of cells of a plant?
Which of the following is the correct order of cell layers in a leaf, from the upper surface down?
options: Upper epidermis, palisade mesophyll, spongy mesophyll, lower epidermis
Upper epidermis, spongy mesophyll, palisade mesophyll, lower epidermis
Lower epidermis, spongy mesophyll, palisade mesophyll, upper epidermis
Lower epidermis, palisade mesophyll, spongy mesophyll, upper epidermis
questions.correct_answer: Upper epidermis, palisade mesophyll, spongy mesophyll, lower epidermis

questions.question: Which of the following is the correct order of cell layers in a leaf, from the upper surface down?
options: Upper epidermis, palisade mesophyll, spongy mesophyll, lower epidermis
Upper epidermis, spongy mesophyll, palisade mesophyll, lower epidermis
Lower epidermis, spongy mesophyll, palisade mesophyll, upper epidermis
Lower epidermis, palisade mesophyll, spongy mesophyll, upper epidermis
questions.correct_answer: Upper epidermis, palisade mesophyll, spongy mesophyll, lower epidermis
